qas.question: What did the NC state legislature pass in 1899?
What type of taxes were required by the new NC constitution?
What did the new constitution require for voter registration?
Being excluded from doing what, made it so that black people could not serve on juries or in public office?
What year was the Federal Civil Rights Act?

context: In 1899 the state legislature passed <a0_0>a new constitution<a0_0/>, with requirements for <a1_0>poll taxes<a1_0/> and <a2_0>literacy tests<a2_0/> for voter registration which disfranchised most black Americans in the state. Exclusion from <a3_0>voting<a3_0/> had wide effects: it meant that black Americans could not serve on juries or in any local office. After a decade of white supremacy, many people forgot that North Carolina had ever had thriving middle-class black Americans. Black citizens had no political voice in the state until after the federal Civil Rights Act of <a4_0>1964<a4_0/> and Voting Rights Act of 1965 were passed to enforce their constitutional rights. It was not until 1992 that another African American was elected as a US Representative from North Carolina.
